title: WATCH: How 7 countries around the world say their I do's
text:
With 11 official languages in South Africa, we are not new to the idea of celebrating weddings differently from one culture to the other.

A Zulu couple has to go through various stages before they can think of walking down the aisle, the first being the payment of lobola, traditionally if the lobola is not paid, the marriage is not legitimate. The proof is in the cattle gents. If you are attending an Indian wedding prepare for a festival - their celebration consists of a three day ceremony starting with the mendhi (henna) ritual.

You might be familiar with how your tribe says I do but other cultures around the world uniquely celebrate the union. From tea ceremonies in China to smashing dishes in Germany, here are seven ways couples celebrate their big day, you might even find some similarities despite the language barries.
